doc2vec.name: window
doc2vec.description: Maximum distance between the current and predicted word within a sentence.

doc2vec.name: min_alpha
doc2vec.description: Learning rate will linearly drop to min_alpha as training progresses.

doc2vec.name: epochs
doc2vec.description: Number of iterations (epochs) over the corpus.

doc2vec.name: min_count
doc2vec.description: Ignores all words with total frequency lower than this.

doc2vec.name: max_vocab_size
doc2vec.description: Limits the RAM during vocabulary building; if there are more unique words than this, then prune the infrequent ones. Every 10 million word types need about 1GB of RAM. Set to -1 for no limit.

doc2vec.name: workers
doc2vec.description: Number of working threads, used for multiprocessing. Use these many worker threads to train the model (=faster training with multicore machines).

doc2vec.name: hs
doc2vec.description: If 1, hierarchical softmax will be used for model training. If 0, and negative is non-zero, negative sampling will be used.

doc2vec.name: negative
doc2vec.description: If > 0, negative sampling will be used, the int for negative specifies how many “noise words” should be drawn

doc2vec.name: ns_exponent
doc2vec.description: The exponent used to shape the negative sampling distribution.

doc2vec.name: seed
doc2vec.description: Seed for the random number generator. Initial vectors for each word are seeded with a hash of the concatenation of word + str(seed).

word2vec.name: window
word2vec.description: Maximum distance between the current and predicted word within a sentence.

word2vec.name: iter
word2vec.description: Number of iterations (epochs) over the corpus.

word2vec.name: min_count
word2vec.description: Ignores all words with total frequency lower than this.

word2vec.name: workers
word2vec.description: Number of working threads, used for multiprocessing. Use these many worker threads to train the model (=faster training with multicore machines).
